name: TheAtlantic
text: Books on the media's role in democracy by @BrianStelter, @sulliview, @ethanmichaeli, and more in this week's #TheAtlanticBooksBriefing. From @marystachyra: https://t.co/NgoLnz9jpm

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Time," a gripping documentary about one family's journey through incarceration, is a cinematic study of Black women’s advocacy for imprisoned loved ones. @samshepPhD writes: https://t.co/OLprdr2XIe

name: TheAtlantic
text: What happens if the Supreme Court overturns the ACA in a pandemic? Listen to Social Distance: https://t.co/XfpWwTTWyc

name: TheAtlantic
text: A billion-dollar gold-mining operation is almost ready to go. What stands in the way? Twenty-five chinchillas. @EdStoddardZA reports: https://t.co/Pv667fg1o4

name: TheAtlantic
text: "My early memories of the Superdome are all noise and crowds and joyful chaos. … That’s why it’s been so strange to see the dome empty thus far this NFL season." @ClintSmithIII reflects on how the New Orleans Saints' stadium mirrors the state of its city: https://t.co/dtjV5AgRWC

name: TheAtlantic
text: "To watch 'The Great British Baking Show' is to believe that the average guy and gal can do remarkable things, that good nature is compatible with excellence, that there are things to life beyond work," @EliotACohen writes: https://t.co/Xo46UXiha6
